messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/19/04 10:34:50 PM Central Standard Time,
tarasamja@... writes:
LOL! I think I have been. I have been over to Samantha's once, if I
am thinking of the right group. If I am not, please let me know.
######

Right group! Hope you can join us more often!
~Nancy

messages.subject: Re: LEARNapalooza Homeschool Conference
messages.msgSnippet: LOL! I think I have been. I have been over to Samantha s once, if I am thinking of the right group. If I am not, please let me know. We are on a really wierd
messages.messageBody:
LOL! I think I have been. I have been over to Samantha's once, if I
am thinking of the right group. If I am not, please let me know. We
are on a really wierd schedule right now, so I haven't really been
able to keep in touch with them. Hopefully that will change soon
though. - Tara

--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, Dnowens@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 3/19/04 09:08:35 PM Central Standard Time,
> tarasamja@s... writes:
> Yes, I live in Lawrence. I was only going to go to some of the
> workshops held by JTG with a friend, who is also unschooling. Are
> you a member of LEARN? - Tara
> #########
>
> You're in Lawrence? We are in Topeka, there is another family in
Lawrence,
> another two in Topeka (besides my family), and another in
Burlingame (Osage
> Co.). We all get together as often as we can coordinate our
calendars. Would you
> like to join our little, growing, informal group? Let me know and
I will pass
> out everyone's email addresses.
> ~Nancy
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: LEARNapalooza Homeschool Conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/19/04 09:08:35 PM Central Standard Time, tarasamja@sunflower.com writes: Yes, I live in Lawrence. I was only going to go to some of the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/19/04 09:08:35 PM Central Standard Time,
tarasamja@... writes:
Yes, I live in Lawrence. I was only going to go to some of the
workshops held by JTG with a friend, who is also unschooling. Are
you a member of LEARN? - Tara
#########

You're in Lawrence? We are in Topeka, there is another family in Lawrence,
another two in Topeka (besides my family), and another in Burlingame (Osage
Co.). We all get together as often as we can coordinate our calendars. Would you
like to join our little, growing, informal group? Let me know and I will pass
out everyone's email addresses.
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

Yes, I live in Lawrence. I was only going to go to some of the
workshops held by JTG with a friend, who is also unschooling. Are
you a member of LEARN? - Tara

messages.subject: Re: LEARNapalooza Homeschool Conference
messages.msgSnippet: Tara, I will be there too! If you are planning to bring your family and use the child care area you should hurry. Space if filling up.  I live in Liberty, MO.
messages.messageBody:
Tara,

I will be there too! If you are planning to bring your family and use the
child care area you should hurry. Space if filling up. I live in Liberty,
MO. Are you in KS?

Cindy

messages.subject: LEARNapalooza Homeschool Conference
messages.msgSnippet: LEARNapalooza Homeschool Conference Memorial Weekend 2004 www.kclearn.org Hyatt Regency Crown Center Kansas City, MO Memorial Day Weekend May 28, 29, & 30th
messages.messageBody:
LEARNapalooza Homeschool Conference
Memorial Weekend 2004
www.kclearn.org


Hyatt Regency Crown Center
Kansas City, MO
Memorial Day Weekend
May 28, 29, & 30th

Key Note presenters
Linda Dobson
John Taylor Gatto


Families from all of these states have registered so far......

Iowa, Kansas, Missouri, Nebraska, Ohio, Oklahoma, Wisconsin

We are offering an unschooling, veteran, new homeschooler, kids, teens and other tracks.

Here are some of the workshops being offered.....

Q & A Discussion on Unschooling
presenter - Victoria Moran

Creating Your Family's Personal Education Philosophy (PEP)
presenter - Linda Dobson

Breaking-the-Rules Homeschooling
presenter - Victoria Moran

The Curriculum of Power - PART ONE
presenter - John Gatto
Two Part Workshop

The Curriculum of Power - PART TWO
presenter - John Gatto

You want to do WHAT? - When One Parent Thinks Homeschooling isn't a Good Idea.
presenter - Matthew Westra

The Future is Now! - Homeschooling with Younger Teens
presenter - David Albert

"Creative" Recordkeeping
presenter - Jane Van Benthusen

Special Schooling for Special Kids
presenter - Kelly Midkiff

Homeschooled Kids in College
presenter - Matthew Westra

Homeschooling Styles
presenters - panel

The World as Your Classroom
presenter - panel presentation/Q&A

Beans and the Curriculum of Creamed Corn
presenter - David Albert

Raising Children Compassionately
presenter - Jean Ryan

Writing, Reading, and All That
presenter - David Albert

Deschooling Q&A
presenter - Linda Dobson

So Your Kid Wants to go to School
presenter - TBA

Translating Daily Life Into Recordable Hours
presenter - TBA

What About Socialization
presenter - Kriss Miller

The Proof is in the Pudding
presenter - Panel Discussion presented by unschooled teens

What is Dyslexia?
Presenter - Wesli Johnson


There is a bunch of cool stuff planned for all of the kids too. :) Check out the website www.kclearn.org and help us spread the word. Thanks, Jane :)




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
